page.title: 16People and Beliefs in Dunmow
page.content: The people of Dunmow are overwhelmingly of the white ethnic majority; the exceptions being a few Vietnamese and the families running the Indian restaurants and Chinese "take away". From a questionnaire it was found that the majority of the junior school pupils believe in God and that God made man. Very few attend church but many said that they would send their own children to Sunday school. School assembly was unpopular, especially hymn singing. Many old people were found to believe in life after death but only 50% believe in God. There is a thriving Roman Catholic community in Dunmow and a small strict Baptist community.
